newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian bonds show easier bias awaiting RBA.
newsitem.headline: Australian bonds show easier bias awaiting RBA.

text.p: *Australian bonds showed a marginally easier bias in early trading as the market nervously awaited the RBA's usual policy announcement time at 9.30 a.m. (2330 GMT).
*50 b.p. official rate cut factored in.
Australian bond futures showed a marginally easier bias in early trading as the market nervously awaited the Reserve Bank's usual policy announcement time at 9.30 a.m. (2330 GMT).

This week's benign outcomes for both inflation and wages has further enhanced expectations for a cut in current official 5.5 percent interest rates, given the economy is still not firing on all cylinders and that unemployment remains high.
However, there are mixed opinions as to whether the central bank will ease on the back of "good" inflationary news today or wait until after the next board meeting on August 5.

The market unwound some of Thursday's spread tightening to the dollar bloc in early trading. The Australian/U.S. 10-year bond yield spread made a strong test of 25 basis points on Thursday, its lowest level since the early 1980s following the weaker than expected wages report.
